Router Reborn
By Tom E. Voll

page.title: Router
page.text:
The router has the following modes: * Extract * Output
It also has the ability to eject items when clogged if it is in Output mode and a eject upgrade is installed.
Side selection in the main tab is where you can choose what side on a target inventory to insert to or extract from.
An example would be an array of vanilla furnaces where you would like to insert ores at the top and coal at the sides, or extract from the bottom.

page.title: Router
page.text:
When in slot mode, all sides on the target are checked for access to the given slot.
If both old and new router is enabled in the config you can convert between them by putting them in a crafting table.
Both routers are exactly the same except from the appearance.

Installing a upgrade is done by sneaking and right click the router with the upgrade in your hand.
Upgrades can be uninstalled by opening the gui of the router select the tab and then press 'DEL' on your keyboard.

Thorough:
Will make the router try and fill all slots in 1 target before moving on to the next.
Keep in mind if you put random items in the router, a item not able to enter the target will force the router to move on to the next available target.
It will be useful in a array of furnaces where you want to fill 1 furnace with a type of ore before moving on to the next.
Without thorough the items will be spread out over all available targets.

Speed Upgrade:
This is handy in a barrel like sorting system where you need the router to skip barrels that can not take the current item quickly.
It will make the router jump to the next available target immediately instead of (default config with a tickrate of 2) 10 each second.
With a setup of 200 barrels where only 1 barrel can accept the item it will take 20 seconds to find it without a speed upgrade.
If Thorough is installed this upgrade does nothing.

Bandwidth Upgrade:
Will make the router transfer a stack instead of a single item each time.
Combine this with a speed upgrade and Storage Units and it can handle sorting from 2-3 Buildcraft quarry's at full speed.

Eject Upgrade:
Allows the router to eject items to a chest or pipe on the chosen side when in extract mode.
When in output mode this upgrade work as a protection against blocking the router with a item that has nowhere to go. If the router can not find a inventory to put the current item in it will try and eject it to a chest or pipe on the chosen side.

Item Filter:
You can add up to 9 items in the filter. They can be blacklisted or whitelisted. Items will not be used up when put in the filter.
There is a option to ignore metadata/damage.
Ore dictionary is used in the filter, adding a copper ore will allow all copper ores to pass.

Machine Filter:
Allows you to specify what machine to interact with, blacklist or whitelist can be selected.
Visit near. Visit near work in the following way:
You got a chest, then a furnace, and then a chest again.
Selecting the chest in the filter only the first chest will be transfered to, when the router hit a inventory that is not selected it will not go beyond it.

Inventory Cable
Can be used as a link between blocks Will not work for eject

Camouflage
Allows you to camouflage the router or cable. Select the block you want to disguise the router or cable as by right clicking the camouflage device on it.
Activate it by sneak right click it on a router or cable. To remove it sneak right click it again.

Storage Unit
* Tier 1: limit of 64 stacks. * Tier 2: limit of 1024 stacks. * Tier 3: limit of 4096 stacks.
All Units can be locked ether empty or with a item.
Upgrade of a unit can be done in place by having a higher tier unit in your hand and sneak + right click it on the unit you want to upgrade. The unit replaced will be returned to your inventory.
Units can be easily moved with a wrench. TE hammer is supported.

Portable crafting
Crafting table on a stick, allowing you to craft anywhere without placing down a crafting table.
Work just as a normal minecraft crafting table.
